What do you do when you’ve been treated unfairly?

In this eye-opening episode, John and Arden reveal how your response to injustice shapes your character and your future. Together, they unpack how responding with honor—like David did with Saul—can break cycles of bitterness and release God’s blessing into your life. Watch now and discover the freedom that comes when you choose God’s way of dealing with mistreatment.

What if offense is the very thing holding you back from your God-given destiny?

In part 2 of their conversation, John and Arden Bevere dive into how holding on to unforgiveness can block God’s plan for your life. Drawing on Joseph’s story, Jesus’ teachings on forgiveness, and their own experiences, they show how bitterness can harm us and share practical steps to find healing—like praying for those who hurt you and seeking godly guidance. This episode equips you to release offense, embrace freedom, and step fully into the life God has for you.

______________________________________

______________________________________
We cannot believe the lie that we are separated from God.
John Bevere sits down with his son, Addison, to tackle common misunderstandings about prayer and share simple, practical ways to grow closer to God. They discuss how easy it is to fall into routine or distracted prayer, why protecting the morning is so important, and how through Jesus, our High Priest, we always have access to God. Drawing from his new Words With God Prayer Journal, Addison shares a 40-day rhythm to help you rediscover life-giving prayer.
This episode will equip you to stop performing, start hearing God, and experience prayer that truly transforms your life.

What if your God-given purpose isn’t about power, but perseverance in weakness?John and Arden Bevere reveal how the Church of Philadelphia earned Christ’s highest praise by staying faithful despite “little strength.” Drawing from his early ministry, John shows the difference between doors we try to force open and doors God opens. Learn why faithful obedience matters more than personal ambition, how to discern God’s timing, and how perseverance in faith leads to lasting Kingdom influence.Listen now and discover how faithfulness shapes your purpose and sets the stage for God’s plans to unfold in your life.

What happens when conviction meets compassion in today's divided church?

In this special episode of the John Bevere Podcast, John joins his sons Addison and Arden to tackle the ripple effects of Charlie Kirk's death, revealing how fear and offense threaten to blind believers to God's current move of His Spirit. Through personal stories and biblical wisdom, they explore how leaders can navigate cultural tensions while staying true to Scripture. This timely message calls Christians to embrace both truth and love—choosing bold faithfulness over comfortable silence.

Don't miss this crucial conversation about unity, courage, and revival in challenging times.

Is American Christianity truly alive—or just playing the part? In Part 2 of this powerful conversation on Jesus’ words to the church at Sardis, John and Arden Bevere confront the sobering truth: outward success doesn’t always mean spiritual life. Together they expose the danger of having “a reputation for being alive” while drifting into spiritual deadness—and share what it takes to wake up, return to obedience, and see real transformation.

My heart is deeply saddened by the loss of one of our nation’s heroes, Charlie Kirk.

Church, we must now become BOLD in declaring the truth.

John 12:24

What does it mean to live a life fully set apart for God?

In this episode, John and Arden continue their study in Revelation with Jesus’ message to the church in Thyatira. They reveal how God looks past our words to see the reality of our actions. We are called to confront the seductive influences, symbolized by “Jezebel,” that lead us into sin and idolatry. If you’ve been battling compromise or feeling pulled away from wholehearted devotion, this conversation will help you clear the distractions and return to full surrender. 

Discover how letting go of idols opens the door to true freedom, deeper intimacy with God, and a life that glorifies Him.

title: Jesus Praised This Church (But Their Life Was Hell)
description:
What does it mean to remain faithful in a world filled with darkness and despair?

In this episode, John and Arden unpack Jesus’ message to the persecuted church in Smyrna (Revelation 2:8–11). They remind us that true wealth isn’t found in success or comfort—but in spiritual resilience. If you’re feeling pressure at work, in your family, or within your own heart, this conversation will help you find clarity and courage to stand firm.

Join us and discover how your trials can build unshakable faith and lead to eternal reward.

title: Jesus Threatened to Shut This Church Down – Here’s What Went Wrong
description:
In this episode, John and Arden dive into the powerful message Jesus gave to the Church of Ephesus in Revelation. 

They explore how this church was praised for their hard work but also rebuked for losing their love. They discuss the dangerous trap of focusing on truth without love and why it’s so important to keep both.

They challenge you to reflect on your own heart and ask: Have you lost your first love for Jesus?

title: Eagerly Waiting for His Return: The Key to Staying Energized
description:
Are you ready for Jesus’ return?

John Bevere and Arden discuss how, like Simeon recognizing the infant Jesus, we should live righteous, devout lives with reverence for God’s Word, eagerly awaiting His return.

They contrast this with those who are unprepared, ashamed, or even misled, focusing on outward signs but neglecting inward transformation. Join us as we examine what it truly means to be ready for Christ’s return.

title: The Church in America doesn't even have a bikini!👙🫣

They contrast this with those who are unprepared, ashamed, or even misled, focusing on outward signs but neglecting inward transformation.

Are you building a beautiful garment or just barely escaping? Join us as we examine what it truly means to be ready for Christ’s return.

Dr. Lester Summerall, a well-known minister, predicted 1984 that people would one day hold a small device to control their lives. Today, with smartphones dominating our daily routines, his prediction has become a reality. John and Darren Whitehead explore the effects that excessive screen time has, particularly among teenagers, and how it is contributing to increased anxiety and a decline in social intelligence. He emphasizes the importance of breaking free from the constant digital distractions and reclaiming our time and attention.

title: How Your Life CHANGES Future Generations
description:
Intimacy with God is key to living free, and hearing His voice is a key part of developing intimacy. Get the Hearing God course free here → https://messengerinternational.org/hearing-god-course-yt/
_____________________
______________
Wanting to transform your life? Check out John's book, "The Awe of God" to develop a healthy fear of God. Grab a copy here: https://amzn.to/4bLU2uu
_______________
Do you long for an intimate relationship with your Creator, but He seems elusive? Perhaps it is because something utterly essential is missing—the fear of the Lord. Don't let this frighten you. Fearing God is very different than being afraid of God. It's the key to everything... including leaving a legacy for the generations to come. 

Holy Fear is not a topic you'll hear much about these days. But if you want to build a faith that stands strong through troubled times, you cannot afford ignorance. 

In this sermon, I invite you to take a fresh look at what it means to work out your salvation with fear and trembling. Why? This healthy, holy, and largely forgotten virtue is the uncommon path to a more fulfilled and fruitful life.

Get my book “The Awe of God” on Messenger International: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/the-awe-of-god

title: The Bait of Satan — How to Escape the Deadly Trap of Offense
description:
Welcome to the Bait of Satan 30th Anniversary live event! 
EVENT SPECIAL: Get The Bait of Satan book & get the audiobook + course as bonuses: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/the-bait-of-satan
___________________

The Bait of Satan exposes one of the most deceptive snares Satan uses to get believers out of the will of God--offense. This trap restrains countless Christians, severs relationships, and widens the gulfs between us. Jesus said, "It is impossible that no offenses should come” (Luke 17:1). So many Christians carry offense through life, completely unaware that they are giving the enemy an open door to wreak havoc.

You can't control everything that happen to you in life—but you can always choose your response. Will you hold onto bitterness, anger, and resentment, or will you embrace the better way of forgiveness and all that it leads to? One road leads to death. The other, to life. Choose the narrow way and don't take the enemy's bait!

title: Fearful of the 2024 Solar Eclipse? WATCH THIS!!
description:
On April 8th, 2024 there will be a solar eclipse marking a unique 'X' across the USA, not seen since 2017. I want to speak to the fear many are feeling.

Isaiah 8:11 says, the the Lord has given me a strong warning not to think like everyone else thinks. He said, don't live in dread or in fear of what they fear. He said instead make me holy in your life. He says, if you do this, I will keep you safe.

If you walk in the healthy fear of God, you are promised by our Creator to to remain safe.

Embracing a holy fear of God can free us from all earthly fears and anxieties. That's why I wrote The Awe of God. If you haven't yet gotten a copy, I encourage you to read it. I truly believe this message will change your life as it did mine.

Let's see the people of God free from the fear that so many others are walking in!

Amazon now has the best deal I've seen at almost 50% off. You can grab your copy here: https://go.MessengerX.com/hlX7Jc 

And if you would like to learn more about the 2024 solar eclipse, I've included a link from NASA that explains it in further detail:

https://science.nasa.gov/solar-system/skywatching/how-is-the-2024-total-solar-eclipse-different-than-the-2017-eclipse/

title: Are You Distorting Scripture for Your Own Sin?  - John Bevere #shorts
description:
Watered-Down Gospel Driving People From Christ - It's Time to Reset
Have diluted half-truths replaced the full force of Scripture? This video explores how the modern church has drifted from biblical foundations - and the devastating impact it's having.

I address topics like:
How a simplified "sinner's prayer" distorts the meaning of salvation
The danger of widening God's message just to draw bigger crowds
The essential role the fear of the Lord plays in following Christ
The need to preach ALL of God's truth - not just palatable parts
How churches must reset to restore power and purpose to the gospel

This is a wake-up call for the church to return to the pure, unfiltered truth of Scripture - in all its power and mystery. When we fully revere and submit to God's Word, lives are radically changed. Souls are set on fire for Christ again!

The time is now to reset. To once again proclaim God's unmatched majesty that demands awe and obedience. Come rediscover the life-altering force of the unedited Gospel. Revival awaits!

title: What You're Missing Out On - John Bevere  #johnbevere #shorts
description:
Do flawed leaders cause you to react in anger or offense? Though vengefulness seems justified, God calls us to a higher response - honoring position, even when behavior misses the mark. 

In this wisdom-filled video, discover how to stay rooted in God's grace when leaders fail you. Learn to: Follow position rather than flawed behavior. Refrain from defending yourself or seeking vengeance. Allow God to make wrongs right in His timing. Rise above through faith, not offended reaction. 

Fulfill your calling to honor in every circumstance. Through biblical truths and personal stories, gain insight into maintaining honor and avoiding offense. You'll find freedom from the urge to avenge yourself! Commit justice to God and see how choosing humility and restraint positions you to receive His full blessings. You were made to honor the Lord, even in difficult environments. Discover that grace-empowered life today!


Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Bait of Satan course here: https://3szn.short.gy/hABVtJ 

Get my book The Bait of Satan here: https://3szn.short.gy/QjMEOa

title: Do You Tolerate Sin? - John Bevere #shorts #johnbevere
description:
Watch the FULL sermon here: https://youtu.be/hC5FHSY06Xk 

Did you know that Half-Hearted Obedience is Disobedience?

Be honest - do you treat God casually without much thought or reverence? Is your relationship marked by flippant shallowness versus deep intimate awe? Do you obey only when convenient or seek to glorify Him with all that you are? 

In this convicting yet uplifting message, I share hard but necessary truths about the forgotten fear of the Lord.

God deeply desires close friendship with us, but it requires that we rightly fear and honor Him. Are you treating the Lord as commonplace? Join me as we remember why our awesome God deserves our awe and wholehearted obedience. The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom! Rediscover this lost gift today by Escaping the Trap of Casual Christianity

title: Breaking Free From Father Wounds
description:
No leader is perfect. Even godly leaders make mistakes. John distinguishes between a leader’s position and a leader’s behavior. He encourages you to remain honoring rather than critical and offended toward your leaders. He also guides you on how to commit your situation to God, allowing Him to make things right. In this discussion, we are taking a deep dive into overcoming father wounds. You are not alone!

title: Leading a Church or Ministry? Don’t Miss the Healthy Pastor Course!
description:
The Healthy Pastor — do those two words even belong in the same sentence? Being a pastor is a calling that carries immense challenges. The day-to-day and long-term responsibilities of a life dedicated to ministry can overwhelm even those who start off with the best of intentions. 

How do you build a healthy, thriving church without sacrificing your own spiritual, marital, physical, mental, and familial health? Is it even possible? Few people really understand the weight most pastors carry. 

The Healthy Pastor course, taught by John Bevere, Pastor Jacob Aranza, and Pastor Matt Hagee, was put together to address the most pressing challenges those in a life in ministry face. With more than 100 years of combined ministry experience, they share hard-won lessons and wisdom to equip you not only to stay in the race, but to run it well. You can be a healthy leader who leads a healthy church. 

The Healthy Pastor course will show you how. Don't navigate this journey alone; let us guide you towards a balanced and fulfilling ministry.

For FULL access to this course, CLICK HERE: https://johnbevere.com/healthy-pastor-course

title: Offense Refines Us - John Bevere #shorts  #johnbevere
description:
Absolutely no man, no woman, or devil can get you out of the will of God. There is only one person who can get you out of the will of God—you! John challenges you not to be taken off guard when you’re mistreated or experience negative circumstances. Rather, he encourages you to trust that God is in control and will cause all things to work together for your good, that is, if you remain unoffended.

title: Why Offenses Will Always Come - John Bevere #shorts #johnbevere
description:
An offense is the bait that Satan uses to trap you. Impossible to avoid, but possible to overcome. John exposes the deceptive progression an offense leads you on and explains how to guard your heart without hardening your heart. He also warns of the dangers of isolation and the unrealistic expectations we place on those closest to us. You will have many opportunities to become offended. How you choose to respond will determine your destiny.

title: Trapped in Offense | Lesson 2 of The Bait of Satan|
description:
Absolutely no man, no woman, or devil can get you out of the will of God. There is only one person who can get you out of the will of God—you! John challenges you not to be taken off guard when you’re mistreated or experience negative circumstances. Rather, he encourages you to trust that God is in control and will cause all things to work together for your good, that is, if you remain unoffended.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Bait of Satan course here: https://3szn.short.gy/hABVtJ

title: The Key to Getting Close to God - John Bevere  #shorts #johnbevere
description:
Watch the FULL sermon here: https://youtu.be/hC5FHSY06Xk 

Did you know that Half-Hearted Obedience is Disobedience?

Be honest - do you treat God casually without much thought or reverence? Is your relationship marked by flippant shallowness versus deep intimate awe? Do you obey only when convenient or seek to glorify Him with all that you are? 

In this convicting yet uplifting message, I share hard but necessary truths about the forgotten fear of the Lord.

God deeply desires close friendship with us, but it requires that we rightly fear and honor Him. Are you treating the Lord as commonplace? Join me as we remember why our awesome God deserves our awe and wholehearted obedience. The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom! Rediscover this lost gift today by Escaping the Trap of Casual Christianity

title: Are You Using Your Gifts Wisely? | Lesson 6 of Driven By Eternity | Study with John Bevere
description:
Those who serve faithfully in the kingdom will be rewarded at the Judgment Seat of Christ. We will be rewarded for our work individually, as each of us have been given different callings and responsibilities with the purpose of impacting lives for eternity. John reveals how God does not reward as man does. He rewards according to righteous works of obedience—which include how we build the kingdom and how we influence individual lives.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

title: Discover Your True Calling | Lesson 5 of Driven By Eternity | Study with John Bevere
description:
Our ability to build the kingdom is entirely based upon our obedience to the Holy Spirit because we can do nothing of eternal value unless it is by the grace of Jesus Christ. We can build apart from God’s Spirit, yet that labor is worthless in the light of eternity. It will be burned up at the Judgment Seat. John teaches that at the Judgment Seat of Christ, we’ll not be judged according to what we did, but according to what we were called to do. Because only acts of obedience will guarantee that our labor is not in vain.
Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

title: You Have a Purpose | Lesson 4 of Driven By Eternity | Study with John Bevere
description:
Everyone will face judgment one day, including Christians. No one is exempt. It will surely come for all people. Sadly, numerous individuals in the church are unaware that they will give an account of what they’ve done during their short stay on earth. John addresses the erroneous idea that all future judgment is eradicated by salvation. Indeed, Jesus’s blood cleanses us from the sins that would have kept us from the kingdom; however, it does not exempt us from the judgment of how we conducted ourselves as believers, whether good or bad.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

title: Fearing God vs. Scared of God | Lesson 3 of Driven by Eternity| Study with John Bevere
description:
In a careful study of the Gospels, you’ll notice that Jesus spoke of and described hell more than He did heaven. He did this to plant a foundation within us—the fear of God. Those who lack this foundation will surely slip into the fear of man, and we ultimately serve who we fear. John teaches on the importance of cultivating the fear of the Lord in our life—which includes a holy awe of the judgments of Christ.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

Get my book Driven By Eternity here: https://3szn.short.gy/Zz3Jgh

title: Hell Is for Real | Lesson 2 of Driven By Eternity | Study with John Bevere
description:
Scripture tells us hell is a real place, not figurative as our society has endeavored to promote. Because it is one of His elementary teachings, Jesus discussed hell frequently, much more often than the subject is mentioned from pulpits today. He didn’t view its mention as insensitive or as lacking compassion. John discusses how the teaching of hell is an essential component for preparing people to receive the gospel.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

description:
Eternity has been placed in our hearts, and each of us sense that we were made for more. Even those who have hardened their hearts to convince themselves there is no God have come to realize at the end of their lives, there is something more beyond death. John reveals the importance of maximizing our time on earth so that we can make our life count both now and for eternity.

title: Pursuing Holiness [FULL SERMON] | John Bevere |
description:
Have You Been Chasing the Wrong Things? Rediscover the Life-Giving Pursuit of Holiness.

It's so easy to unconsciously drift into chasing empty things instead of pursuing God's holiness. We gravitate toward what "feels good" instead of what aligns with Scripture's correction and guidance. Before we know it, we're far off course, chasing fleeting distractions rather than lasting fruit.

In this teaching, I uncover the dangers of drifting into chasing ungodly things. You'll rediscover what God says about righteous pursuit and get back on track with passionately chasing holiness.

I'll provide practical ways to stop chasing distractions and realign your heart to chase God's presence and righteous living. You'll walk away inspired, equipped and refocused on joyfully pursuing holiness above all else. Don't settle for chasing temporary things. Rediscover the abundant life waiting for you in the godly pursuit of holiness!

title: You Can’t Put New Wine in Old Wine Skins | Lesson 10 of Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
God sometimes changes how He is working in and through us, and change can be difficult for us. Knowing this, God provides a way for us to stay flexible and move with Him. When we allow Him to empty us, then wash us in His word, and we press into Him in prayer, He renews us to be able to carry His new movement.

title: How Wilderness Seasons Reveal Your Calling | Lesson 8 of Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
When God wants to separate us unto Himself, He sometimes has to remove us from the other voices that influence our lives. In Scripture, He physically did this with people like Moses, David, Paul, and John the Baptist. It was during these wilderness seasons that He produced holiness in them, the holiness enabled them to see God, and through seeing God they were marked for their calling. It was what God revealed to them in the wilderness that enabled them to be who God created them to be, and it will be the same for us.


Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC 

Want to dive deeper? Get the book, "God, Where Are You?!" from the Messenger International store: are https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/god-where-are-you?_pos=1&_sid=21eef1df7&_ss=r

title: How to Overcome Your Spiritual Dryness | Lesson 9 of Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
During dry seasons of the soul, the greatest temptation is to run to worldly things for comfort—television, social media, food, and much more—but we must choose to turn instead to God. This requires us to dig wells within ourselves, persevering in worship, prayer, and meditating on God’s faithfulness. Despite the trials of dry times, these habits will refresh us and enable us to become rivers of life wherever we go.

title: Are You Birthing an Ishmael? |  Lesson 7 of the Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
God gives promises to each one of us, but His plan to fulfill them will require faith, which means His fulfillment isn’t going to look like what makes sense to us in the natural. We must surrender our natural understanding and plans to follow His leading, because only His leading will fulfill His promises the right way. If we work in our own strength, we will produce a fulfillment that actually wars against God’s intended purpose.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

title: Is God Trying to Make Your Spirit Strong? |  Lesson 6 of the Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
God will not test us beyond our current strength but works to grow our strength through wilderness seasons. We need the strength we gain through the wilderness for future assignments we are not currently ready for. These assignments are part of God’s plan for us, and we will be accountable before Jesus for them someday, whether we were prepared to fulfill them or whether we weren’t ready for the lack of enduring the wildernesses.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC

title: Look Out: This Will Try to Derail Your Calling | Lesson 5 of the Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
Jesus foretold an army of people who would prophetically prepare for His coming. He chooses this army through the process of refinement. Those who fear God and honor His name choose to endure the painful seasons of the wilderness, choosing to praise God instead of complaining in bitterness. These believers prove themselves to be fit vessels for God’s service and will be used of God for His great purposes.

title: Don't Let Your Destiny Destroy You | Lesson 4 of the Wilderness| Study with John Bevere
description:
Refining brings to the surface what has always been visible to God yet concealed to us. Just as fire purifies gold; God purifies us through the furnace of affliction, suffering and trials. John reveals that when we cooperate with God’s refining process, we’ll emerge as transparent vessels through which His glory shall be revealed.

title: How to Know If a Promise Is from God | Lesson 3 of the Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
We begin a process as soon as God gives us a promise—every promise will have a process. This process refines and tests us to develop in us the character we need to successfully steward the fulfillment of the promise when it comes. While the promise ushers us into a season of refining, it also propels us through those seasons, knowing God will be faithful to accomplish what His word has spoken.

title: Don't Miss Out: How to Claim Your Full Reward — John Bevere
description:
One day you will stand before God and give an account of your life. The most important question you can ask yourself now is, will you be ready?

Most Christians know their response to the cross determines where they will spend eternity. But did you know that how you’ll spend eternity is determined by what you do in this life?
God wants you to discover your calling—He’s not trying to keep you in the dark. In fact, He longs for you to find the meaning and purpose that comes with knowing why you’ve been placed on this earth.

In this sermon, I want to unveil how your daily choices shape your eternal existence. Life beyond the final breath is much more than a destination. Don’t wait until it’s too late. Discover your God-given destiny and make your life count both today and forever.
 
Watch the full “Driven By Eternity” course on MessengerX: https://app.messengerx.com/en-US/watch/4XOlmP6ToEgkM4AhVqDgr7 

Want to dive deeper? Get my book, “Driven By Eternity!” here: https://store.messengerinternational.org/collections/books-by-john-bevere/products/driven-by-eternity

title: Why You're in the Wilderness | Lesson 2 of the Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
Knowing the purposes of the wilderness helps us recognize these seasons and work in agreement with God. These purposes are to mature, strengthen, humble, and purify us, while also revealing more of both our heart and God’s heart. Focusing on these purposes helps protect us from discouragement or distraction while we press on in God toward His promises.

title: Do You Feel Spiritually Stuck? | Lesson 1 of the Wilderness | Study with John Bevere
description:
Every believer will go through wilderness seasons where they cannot sense God’s presence and feel farther from His promises. 

It is tempting to give up during these seasons, but they are necessary times of preparation that enable us to walk in God’s promises when they are fulfilled. 

We must learn to discern these wilderness seasons and behave in them properly so that we can partner with God’s purposes for them, receive the good He has for us in them, and move into seasons of fruitfulness again.

Want more content like this? Check out the full lesson from the Wilderness course here: https://go.MessengerX.com/WC 

Want to dive deeper? Get the book, "God, Where Are You?!" from the Messenger International store: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/god-where-are-you?_pos=1&_sid=21eef1df7&_ss=r

title: I Never Realized This Was Holding Me Back — John Bevere
description:
Do you feel lost in a difficult season, wondering, “GOD, WHERE ARE YOU?!”
Perhaps you heard God speak, but now He seems silent. Maybe you moved forward in faith, but now His presence is nowhere to be found. Welcome to the wilderness—the place between receiving a promise from God and seeing it come to pass.

But here’s the good news—this is no purposeless wasteland. God uses the wilderness to prepare and equip you for your destiny—that is, if you navigate it correctly.

Watch the full “The Wilderness” course on MessengerX: https://app.messengerx.com/en-US/watch/3CONA5O3nUd2wPQBfsJ0Zt 

Want to dive deeper? Get my book, “God, Where Are You?!” here: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/god-where-are-you?

title: Honor's Reward: Unlocking the Power of this Forgotten Virtue [FULL SERMON] — John Bevere
description:
No Christian wants to place limitations on God, but many of us unknowingly restrict His activity in our lives because we ignore a critical spiritual principle: Honor.

It's a concept primarily lost in our culture, but as you'll see in the pages of this book, it is core to releasing God's kingdom into all aspects of life.

In this sermon, I share how embracing the call to honor aligns you with God's value system and positions you to receive all he has for you.

Pairing profound biblical insights with powerful stories of these principles in action, this book will give you a fresh outlook on this forgotten virtue and, more importantly, a passion for incorporating it into every area of your life.

Dive deeper with my book, "Honor's Reward", on Amazon: https://amzn.to/3I6obZp

Or get, "Honor's Reward", from the Messenger Store here: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/honors-reward

title: Does the Holy Spirit Have a Personality? | Lesson 2 of the Holy Spirit | Study with John Bevere
description:
In order for us to enter into a close relationship with another person, we must first seek to understand what makes that individual tick. Greater knowledge of a person’s likes, dislikes, aims, and ambitions will help develop a deeper friendship. Likewise, if we are to be intimate with the Holy Spirit, we must first seek to understand His personality.

title: Who Is the Holy Spirit? | Lesson 1 of the Holy Spirit | Study with John Bevere
description:
Jesus’s departure was for our benefit—making way for the Holy Spirit to be with us. Yet, many do not know who He is and why He is here. In this lesson, John demystifies the confusion around God’s Spirit and introduces us to the most ignored Person in the church—the Holy Spirit.

Access the “Holy Spirit—Course Guide” guide here: https://app.messengerx.com/en-US/watch/4pZ287f5uSmcIu7WbNaZ6S/brightcoveVideo_6191054949001 

Watch the entire “Holy Spirit” course for free here: https://go.MessengerX.com/HSC

Want to dive deeper? Get my book, “The Holy Spirit: An Introduction Book”, here: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/the-holy-spirit-an-introduction?_pos=1&_sid=f0af6abbe&_ss=r

title: 8 Ways to Approach the Bible | Lesson 6 of Bible Matters | Study with John Bevere
description:
The way in which we approach the Bible will determine what we’ll receive from it. That’s why it’s important to prepare our hearts to study God’s Word. 

In this lesson, Addison and I explain how studying the Bible should be done prayerfully, reverently, desperately, and consistently—which will lead to experiencing the Scriptures in a powerful and profound way.

Watch the full "Bible Matters Course" for free here: https://go.MessengerX.com/BibleMatters

title: Understanding the Major Themes of the Bible | Lesson 5 of Bible Matters | Study with John Bevere
description:
The Bible reveals God’s plans and purposes for mankind. 

Woven within its pages are four major themes: creation, sin and the fall of man, God’s plan for redemption, and the restoration of all things. In this lesson, I share how these themes provide the framework for understanding the Bible’s narrative.

Watch the full "Bible Matters Course" for free here: https://go.MessengerX.com/BibleMatters

In this lesson, Scott and I discuss how the Bible was compiled, why we have different translations, and the best translation for new believers. They also explain why there are many different translations available to us today.

title: Is the Bible Reliable? | Lesson 3 of Bible Matters | Study with John Bevere
description:
God’s Word has stood the test of time. 

Throughout history, no other book has been more scrutinized than the Bible. In this lesson, Scott and I share how many have attempted to discredit and destroy God’s Word—but to no avail. We discuss how history and science actually validate the Bible’s authenticity while also providing many more fascinating facts about God’s Word.

Watch the complete "Bible Matters Course" for free here: https://go.MessengerX.com/BibleMatters

description:

title: Do You Know Everything That Makes God?  — The Awe of God | Study with John Bevere
description:
The glory of the Lord is everything that makes God, God. All His characteristics, authority, power, wisdom—literally the immeasurable weight and magnitude of God. Nothing is hidden or held back. 

Imagine a light so brilliant and pure that no darkness, shadows, dullness, or dimming can be present. Imagine this light shining in your heart. Why would you ever want to think about or hide anything from Him?  

I pray this highlight from my new book, “The Awe of God”, encourages you. 

Get my new book “The Awe of God” on Amazon: https://amzn.to/3ZPo4J6

title: UNBELIEVABLE TESTIMONY: Adopted Son Forgives Biological Mother  — The Bait of Satan | John Bevere
description:
Are you compelled to tell your side of the story? Do you fight thoughts of suspicion or distrust? Are you constantly rehearsing past hurts? Have you lost hope because of what someone did to you?

In this message, I expose one of the most deceptive snares Satan uses to get believers out of the will of God—and that’s offense. This trap restrains countless Christians, severs relationships, and widens the gulfs between us. Jesus said, "It is impossible that no offenses should come” (Luke 17:1). 

Although you will encounter offense, you can choose how you will react. 
Stay free from offense and its destructive power. Get the Bait of Satan book: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/the-bait-of-satan-20th-anniversary?_pos=3&_sid=4d6f7875f&_ss=r

Or dive deeper with my free Bait of Satan course: https://go.MessengerX.com/BOSC

In this message, I expose one of the most deceptive snares Satan uses to get believers out of the will of God—and that’s offense. This trap restrains countless Christians, severs relationships, and widens the gulfs between us. Jesus said, "It is impossible that no offenses should come” (Luke 17:1). 

Although you will encounter offense, you can choose how you will react. 

Stay free from offense and its destructive power. Get the Bait of Satan book: https://store.messengerinternational.org/products/the-bait-of-satan-20th-anniversary?_pos=3&_sid=4d6f7875f&_ss=r

Or dive deeper with my free Bait of Satan course: https://go.MessengerX.com/BOSC

description:

9:53 - Ensuring Submission to Truth 
10:47 - Make It Personal
12:30 - Our Gift To You: 42 Videos 

__________________

More About the Book: 

Do you long for an intimate relationship with your Creator, but He seems elusive? Perhaps it is because something utterly essential is missing—holy fear. Don't let this frighten you. Fearing God is very different than being afraid of God. It's the key to everything.

The fear of the Lord is not a topic you'll hear much about these days. But if you want to build a faith that stands strong through troubled times, you cannot afford to ignore this book.

In The Awe of God, John Bevere invites you to take a fresh look at what it means to work out your salvation with fear and trembling. This healthy, holy, and largely forgotten virtue is the uncommon path to a more fulfilled and fruitful life. In this book, you will see why godly fear is the foundation of:
👉🏼 Wisdom, understanding, and knowledge
👉🏼 Foresight, clarity, and divine direction
👉🏼 Maturity and conformity to the image of Jesus Christ
👉🏼 Building an eternal legacy
👉🏼 Confidence, fearlessness, and security
👉🏼 Freedom from the fear of man as all lesser fears are eclipsed

If you look at the men and women in Scripture, the ones who lived and finish well all have one thing in common: they are marked by holy fear.
The Awe of God was designed to be read slowly and intentionally. At the end of each of the 42 chapters are five tools to help you deepen your understanding and apply what the Spirit of God is teaching you. 

Experience the intimate relationship with God that you have always longed for by unlocking this countercultural message.

title: Prepare Yourself: We Are on the VERGE of One of the GREATEST Moves of God's Spirit — John Bevere
description:
Watch the official Jesus Revolution trailer here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8vmHFvnjPDw

When a move of God's Spirit comes, we can take three approaches: 

1. Stand on the outside and look in
2. Ride the crest of the wave, moving with God
3. Fight against the move of God

It's no accident that the new "Jesus Revolution" movie releases on February 24. From the creators of "I Can Only Imagine", this film beautifully depicts an unexpected national spiritual awakening in the early 1970's within a community of teenage hippies in Southern California—a revival that TIME Magazine would dub the JESUS REVOLUTION. 

I want you, our friends and partners, to prepare for what God's Spirit wants to do throughout the Earth in 2023. This movie is a perfect place to start.

Watch the official Jesus Revolution trailer here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8vmHFvnjPDw

Or visit the movie's official website here: https://jesusrevolution.movie/

The Awe of God: How to TRULY Get Close to God [FULL SERMON] — John Bevere
description:
Do you long for an intimate relationship with your Creator, but He seems elusive? Perhaps it is because something utterly essential is missing—the fear of the Lord. Don't let this frighten you. Fearing God is very different than being afraid of God. It's the key to everything.

Holy Fear is not a topic you'll hear much about these days. But if you want to build a faith that stands strong through troubled times, you cannot afford ignorance. 

In this sermon, I invite you to take a fresh look at what it means to work out your salvation with fear and trembling. Why? This healthy, holy, and largely forgotten virtue is the uncommon path to a more fulfilled and fruitful life.

Get my new book “The Awe of God” on Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Awe-God-Astounding-Healthy-Transforms/dp/1400336708

description:
In this video, I explain how the correct motivation for getting free can actually determine whether or not you get free. So many people genuinely want to be free...but it's for self-serving reasons. This actually serves to keep them stuck for longer. The key is to learn the difference between worldly sorrow and godly sorrow, and to make sure you focus on the latter, as Paul describes in 2 Corinthians 7:10, where he says, "Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death." I hope you get a lot out of this lesson!

description:
Wondering how to study the Bible, but unsure of where to begin? Reading the Bible doesn't have to be complicated or difficult. In fact, God has given us his Holy Spirit to help us understand what He is saying to us through Scripture! Even if you are just starting out, you can dive into the Bible and allow the Holy Spirit to speak to you. In this video, I give you a sample of how I personally study the Bible, and give you practical tools you can implement in your own study of Scripture in order to get more out of it! You don't have to study Scripture exactly as I do—the important thing is that you dive into it and allow the Holy Spirit to guide you along the way!

title: Multiply Your Impact
description:
Do you ever feel like a spectator in God’s kingdom? Perhaps you know there’s something you should be doing, but you just can’t pinpoint it. Most of us want to make a big impact with our lives, but struggle with questions like:  

-How can I be sure I’m not missing God’s will for me? 

-What role do my unique gifts play in building God’s kingdom? 

-How do I make sure I live up to my God-given potential?

-Is my calling less significant if I’m not in “ministry”?

-How do I balance resting in God’s grace with meaningful actions for His kingdom?

-How do I break fear and move forward even when it feels uncertain and risky?

Go deeper on this topic with John's newest X book:
https://store.messengerinternational.org/collections/books-by-john/products/x

Access the audiobook here:

title: What Will Deceive Christians—John Bevere
description:
What's really going to deceive Christians in the last days won't appear as blatant evil. It is going to be a form of good that is blatantly evil in God's eyes. #GoodOrGod

Get your own copy of "Good or God?" on Amazon or MessengerInternational.org.

title: When Grace Gets in Your Boat—John Bevere
description:
Something changes when grace gets in the boat with you…

Grab your own copy of "Good or God?" on Amazon or MessengerInternational.org.

title: Don't Be a Frustrated Christian—John Bevere
description:
One of the fastest ways to become a frustrated Christian is to try to live holy in your own ability. It's impossible. You need the empowerment of God's grace working in you. #GoodOrGod

Get your own copy of "Good Or God?" on Amazon or MessengerInternational.org.

title: There is Nothing Good For You Outside of God—John Bevere
description:
If you want to live free of deception, get this truth firmly established in you: There is nothing good for you outside of God. #GoodOrGod

Get your own copy of "Good Or God?" on Amazon or MessengerInternational.org.

title: Lessons I Learned the Hard Way: Don't Get Ahead of God—John Bevere
description: What you birth in the flesh, you are going to have to provide for in the flesh, but what God's Spirit births in your life, God will provide for. Don't try to make God's promises come to pass in your own ability. God will bring them to fruition in His timing, and it will be better than you could have imagined.

title: Lessons I Learned the Hard Way: When You Aren't Getting Fed in Church—John Bevere
description: Have you ever felt like you weren't being fed in church? In my experience, it is all too easy to point the finger at everyone else, but we would be wise to look inward and ask God to search our own hearts. Here's my story...

title: Lessons I Learned the Hard Way: Step Out in Faith—John Bevere
description: Don't wait to obey until God provides while God is waiting to provide until you obey. When you've heard God's voice and you know He's calling you to do something, step out in faith. The next step will be there.

title: Lessons I Learned the Hard Way: Are We Really Loving People?—John Bevere
description: It's not enough to be known for being loving. We need to actually BE loving. That means that we have to care more about people than their perception of us. We have to love them more than we love our own reputation.

title: Lessons I Learned the Hard Way: Speak the Truth in Love—John Bevere
description: Preview clip of session 1 from "Lessons I Learned the Hard Way.

title: How to be EMPOWERED by the Spirit // Lesson 4 of The Holy Spirit: An Introduction
description:
The baptism of the Holy Spirit is a gift promised to all believers. As we are endued with power from on high, we are set free from the power of sin and equipped with supernatural gifts that enable us to do greater works than Jesus did while He was on earth. 

I discuss how the baptism of God’s Spirit is still available today and how you can receive it yourself.

https://go.MessengerX.com/HSC

title: The Secret to True Intimacy with God // Lesson 3 of The Holy Spirit: An Introduction
description:
The Spirit of God desires to be your friend, and He yearns for your close fellowship. Through His abiding presence, the deepest level of relationship—the spiritual level—is available to you. In this lesson, John reveals how to engage with God’s Spirit at the deepest level, from which you will discover an intimacy with your Creator unlike any other.

title: Demystifying the Holy Spirit — John Bevere
description:
Jesus’s departure was for our benefit—allowing the Holy Spirit to be with us. Yet, many do not know who He is and why He is here. In this lesson, John demystifies the confusion around God’s Spirit and introduces us to the most ignored Person in the church—the Holy Spirit.
